intro: Galium elegans var. javanicum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
